main event: On April 17, 1952, in Sault Ste. Marie, Michigan, an unidentified aerial object with a pink color and circular shape was observed hovering for approximately 60 seconds. The source of the report suggested it may have been a balloon diffusing oblique rays of the sun.
interesting points: The sighting lasted approximately 60 seconds and involved a single object.
The object was described as having a pink color and circular shape and was observed hovering.
The official report suggested that the observed object might have been a balloon reflecting sunlight, given the normality of such a color for a balloon under such conditions.
The report included a list of potential explanations for the sighting, including a weather balloon, kite, friendly aircraft, or various reflections of sunlight.
There were differing observations of the object, with some descriptions mentioning a bluish-green color and an estimated length of 75 to 100 feet.
sighted object: unidentified aerial object with pink color and circular shape
witnesses: Multiple witnesses, including the Michigan State Highway Patrol and other individuals
